<div id="content-wide" class="clearfix">
        
<div class="grid_16">
	<div id="slider" class="block">
		<div class="slide-container">
			<div class="slide-nav">
				<a id="prev" href="#">Previous</a>
				<a id="next" href="#">Next</a>
			</div>
			<div class="slide-holder">
                
						<div class="slide">
							<img src="/-/media/Images/Carousel/covenant-hb-carousel.ashx?h=320&amp;la=en&amp;w=932&amp;hash=BF78840822B34E29993203A54B0659C719979CF9" alt="covenant-hb-carousel" width="932" height="320" />
							<div class="slide-text">
								<div class="grid_7 alpha">
									<h2>Covenant in the Hebrew Bible</h2>
								</div>
								<div class="grid_8 omega">
									In the Hebrew Bible, the covenant is the formal agreement between Yhwh and the people of Israel and Judah, in which each agrees to a set of obligations toward the other.
                                    <br/><br/>
                                    <a class="more" href='/en/people/related-articles/ark-of-the-covenant'>Find Out More &raquo;</a>
                                </div>
							</div>
						</div>
                    
						<div class="slide">
							<img src="/-/media/Images/Carousel/Ancient-Hebrew-Scroll.ashx?h=320&amp;la=en&amp;w=932&amp;hash=4F30A31498CF6E15366F4A019558E00EEE99A303" alt="Ancient Hebrew Scroll" width="932" height="320" />
							<div class="slide-text">
								<div class="grid_7 alpha">
									<h2>The difference between the Old Testament, the Tanakh, and the Hebrew Bible</h2>
								</div>
								<div class="grid_8 omega">
									The (Protestant) Old Testament and the (Jewish) Tanakh share the same books, but our readings differ in language, punctuation, canonical order, and emphases.<br />
                                    <br/><br/>
                                    <a class="more" href='/en/tools/bible-basics/what-are-the-earliest-versions-and-translations-of-the-bible'>Find Out More &raquo;</a>
                                </div>
							</div>
						</div>
                    
						<div class="slide">
							<img src="/-/media/Images/Carousel/grapes-carousel.ashx?h=320&amp;la=en&amp;w=932&amp;hash=3252FFDF6E76EE117E25681061910E5EF7BF5374" alt="grapes-carousel" width="932" height="320" />
							<div class="slide-text">
								<div class="grid_7 alpha">
									<h2>Nabothâ€™s Vineyard</h2>
								</div>
								<div class="grid_8 omega">
									Textual, historical, and archaeological clues reveal that the prebiblical version of the vineyard story featured a smart queen and a rich Naboth.<br />
                                    <br/><br/>
                                    <a class="more" href='/en/passages/main-articles/naboths-vineyard-1-kgs-21'>Find Out More &raquo;</a>
                                </div>
							</div>
						</div>
                    
						<div class="slide">
							<img src="/-/media/Images/Carousel/chagall-paschal-lamb.ashx?h=320&amp;la=en&amp;w=932&amp;hash=932EA5529C72B6A9D324BC619901EAFFA850B245" alt="chagall-paschal-lamb" width="932" height="320" />
							<div class="slide-text">
								<div class="grid_7 alpha">
									<h2>Moses </h2>
								</div>
								<div class="grid_8 omega">
									There were many different traditions about Moses in ancient Israel and Judah.
                                    <br/><br/>
                                    <a class="more" href='/en/people/main-articles/moses'>Find Out More &raquo;</a>
                                </div>
							</div>
						</div>
                    
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>				
		<div class="clear"></div>
		<div class="grid_16">
			<div class="grid_10 alpha">
                <h1>Bible Odyssey: People, Places, and Passages</h1>
<p>Explore the fascinating origins of the Bible and its eventful history. On Bible Odyssey, the world&rsquo;s leading scholars share the latest historical and literary research on key people, places, and passages of the Bible.</p>
				<div class="button clearfix">
                    <a href="/en/ask-a-scholar" id="phcontent_0_ctl02_htmlAskAScholar"><span><img src='/img/ask-icon.png' alt='Ask a Scholar'></span>Ask a Scholar</a>
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="grid_6 omega">
				<div class="focus">
					<div class="magnifier">
						<img src="/img/magnifier.png" alt="">
						<div class="magnifier-text">
							<h4>Focus On</h4>
							<h6>
                                <a id="phcontent_0_ctl02_lnkFocusTitle" href="/en/places/related-articles/judah-and-the-house-of-david">The Divided Monarchy</a>
                            </h6>
						</div>
					</div>
					<div class="focus-text">
						Briefly united under David and Solomon, Israel in the north and Judah in the south were separate kingdoms for centuries, indicating strong differences between the two.
					</div>
					<div class="dark-bar"></div>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
		<div class="clear"></div>
        
		<div class="grid_4">
            <div class="block excerpt-block">
                <a href='/en/people/main-articles/cain'>
			        <img src='/-/media/Images/People/C/cain-and-abel-woodcut.ashx' width='201' height='142' alt='Cain and Abel, 1564. Woodcut, from Die Gantze Bibel, printed in Germany by Christoph Froschauer. Courtesy of the Digital Image Archive, Pitts Theology Library, Candler School of Theology, Emory University.' title='Cain and Abel, 1564.' />
				    <h6>Cain</h6>
				    <p>The biblical story of Cain killing Abel raises questions about why Cain killed Abel, reflecting the concern of biblical law to determine the intentions and state of mind of a killer.</p>
                </a>
            </div>
		</div>
    
		<div class="grid_4">
            <div class="block excerpt-block">
                <a href='/en/people/related-articles/parables-of-jesus'>
			        <img src='/-/media/Images/People/P/parables-of-jesus-1.ashx' width='201' height='142' alt='Paula Modersohn-Becker, The Good Samaritan. Oil and tempera on canvas, 1907.' title='Paula Modersohn-Becker, The Good Samaritan, 1907.' />
				    <h6>The Parables of Jesus</h6>
				    <p>The parables of Jesus are analogies-chisels, if you will-that break through insensitivity to teach about the kingdom and the response and obedience it demands.</p>
                </a>
            </div>
		</div>
    
		<div class="grid_4">
            <div class="block excerpt-block">
                <a href='/en/places/related-articles/christian-martyrdom'>
			        <img src='/-/media/Images/Passages/1-9/666-nero.ashx' width='201' height='142' alt='Agrippina crowns her son Nero with a laurel wreath. Aphrodisias Museum, Geyre, Turkey.' title='Agrippina crowns her son Nero with a laurel wreath.' />
				    <h6>Christian Martyrdom </h6>
				    <p>Christians faced persecution intermittently from the first century C.E. until the legalization of Christianity in the fourth century.</p>
                </a>
            </div>
		</div>
    
		<div class="grid_4">
            <div class="block excerpt-block">
                <a href='/en/tools/audio-gallery/d/did-pauls-thinking-on-women-change-martin'>
			        <img src='/-/media/Images/People/P/paul.ashx' width='201' height='142' alt='The Apostle Paul' title='Apostle Paul, circa 494â€“519 C.E. ' />
				    <h6>Did Paul&#39;s Thinking on Women Change?</h6>
				    <p>Dale Martin reflects on whether we can trace any change in Paulâ€™s thinking.</p>
                </a>
            </div>
		</div>
    
				
    </div>

     </div>
</div>
